technology.short_description: The hellscape beyond the Great Bastion is not wholly evil and deviod of use. The broken earth there has exposed rich deposits of iron, near lava capable of alloying the finest steels.
Cathayan horses are no less flighty than their otherwise inferior Old World kin, but an expert rider knows that bestowing stillness upon their anxious steed is paramount to victory.

Those Dragon-Blooded who do not wish to command armies or master the magical arts may seek recognition in more stately professions. Behind silk fans and sweeping gowns they plot the rise and fall of nations, all for the glory of the Dragon Emperor.
Cathayan settlements are typically utilitarian, concealing trenches and blockhouses amidst the regular market and residential landscapes. All citizens know their place should battle break out.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +10 when under siege
	(all characters factionwide)

technology.short_description: It is the Jade Warriors who keep the great cities of Cathay safe, but they are too gracious to demand promotion. Thus, we must identify and raise up their finest ourselves.

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Jade Warriors and Jade Warriors (Halberds) units
Recruit rank: +2 for Jade Warriors and Jade Warriors (Halberds) units

technology.short_description: The perfect warriors are selected from an early age. Being already a tiny minority, only exceptionally few within the Dragon-Blooded will serve among the exalted Celestial Dragons.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +4 for Celestial Dragon Guard and Celestial Dragon Crossbowmen units

technology.short_description: All Cathay gathers for war. There is no fear, no dissent. The Dragon Emperor guides our hearts and minds.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for all units (Rank 7 and above)
Missile damage: +10% for all units (Rank 7 and above)

technology.short_description: The Moon Empress can taken any form, and it is thanks to her time spent running with the herds, free as the wind, that we may now learn the language of horses.

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Peasant Horsemen, Jade Lancers and Great Longma Riders units

technology.short_description: The school of Feng Shi sorcery, named for the Dragon Emperor himself, grants strength and protection to all those who wield it. It is the highest honour to march beneath the Yang banner.

effects.description: Grants the Banner of Feng Shi banner to your faction

items.colour_text: An ancient banner doused in the sorcerous power of the Dragon Emperor himself, granting strength and protection.

technology.short_description: It takes time for a newly-awakened Sentinel to regain its full might, as it sheds the moss and earth of years, but the correct incantations will instantly purge all such detritus.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Terracotta Sentinel units

technology.short_description: Every Spirit Qilin yearns to return to the Celestial Mountains, and have been known to depart for them even in the heat of battle. Incanting a Yang rite upon their reins will ensure obedience.

effects.description: Charge bonus: +25 for Great Longma Riders units

technology.short_description: As majestic as jade, as unbreakable as stone: this what every devoted warrior of Cathay, whether born to power or peasantry, must eternally strive to be.

effects.description: Vigour loss reduction: -15% for Jade Warriors, Jade Warriors (Halberds) and Jade Warrior Crossbowmen units

technology.short_description: As the Dragon Emperor once more directs His great compass to harness the Eight Winds, a great wave of Yang shall infuse the land, bestowing good fortune and prosperity upon every soul.
Stillness of the mind and soul are virtues to which we all must aspire. Only with impeccable discipline and balance may we truly prevail against wickedness.

effects.description: Income from sacking and looting settlements: +10%

technology.short_description: Once freed from doubt, fear and distrust, their minds governed only by their absolute devotion to the Dragon Emperor, the Celestial legion shall move like the Eight Winds themselves.
Yang is the strength of the soul. Yang is the flame in the heart and the fire in our veins. Yang is the roar from the lungs. Yang is the iron within our bones and the stone beneath our skins.
The Dragon Emperor's Celestial fire burns hotter than all else. Bricks baked in the Burning Wind emerge strong and flawless, all the better to build great monuments to Xen Yang.

effects.description: Construction time: -1 for Yang infrastructure buildings

technology.short_description: The Celestial Dragon will raise us all up – we need only to heed His wisdom. And so, by tapping the flame within their souls, the Dragon Emperor's soldiers shall become tireless.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +5% for Yang armies
Casualty replenishment rate: +5% for Yang armies

technology.short_description: So well-drilled are the Jade Lancers of Cathay, and so fluid their steeds, that they could outflank their enemy even within the narrowest of alleyways.

effects.description: Attribute: Devastating Flanker for Jade Lancers units

technology.short_description: The Dragon Emperor sees all, and so it is that an infusion of His Celestial magic can grant sight beyond sight to His most loyal believers.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +5% for Yang armies

technology.short_description: In public, all obey the Dragon Emperor without question, but in private many provinces vie for independence and power. Those who serve Him faithfully shall be rewarded.

effects.description: Grants the The Great Celestial Banner banner to your faction

items.colour_text: Blessed by his Celestial Majesty Xen Yang, this banner is imbued with great power.

technology.short_description: Rare crystals litter the peaks of Kunlan, each of which absorbed a fragment of the Celestial energy unleashed by the Dragon Emperor's birth. Once socketed into an anvil, divine armour may be forged.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Celestial Dragon Guard units

technology.short_description: But a word from the Sea Dragon is all that is required to grant passage or permit. We may also petition her for aid in constructing coastal defences, for what is the ocean but another bastion?

Harmony brings unity, and unity brings efficiency. The warriors of wind and field must be taught to trust one another implicitly, for each is an extension of the Dragon Emperor's will, fighting as one.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Peasant Long Spearmen units
Leadership: +4 for Peasant Long Spearmen units

technology.short_description: Cathay's provincial troops are loyal and numberless, but they are crude and unrefined soldiers. There is such great potential in them, waiting only to be unlocked.
A system of bellows and fine brass funnels ensures that escaped heat is recaptured and reused rather than wasted, thus granting greater lift and range for our Sky Lanterns.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Sky Lantern units

technology.short_description: All the world envies Cathay's most grandiose technologies, but it is in the smallest of things, such as cogwheels no larger than a hummingbird's eye, that we truly innovate.

effects.description: Range: +10% for Celestial Dragon Crossbowmen, Jade Warrior Crossbowmen and Jade Warrior Crossbowmen (Shields) units
Armour-piercing missile damage: +2 for Celestial Dragon Crossbowmen, Jade Warrior Crossbowmen and Jade Warrior Crossbowmen (Shields) units

technology.short_description: So numerous are the warriors of wind and field that it is impossible to keep a tally of the wounded, but learned physicians can at least identify the most grievously harmed.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +20% for Peasant Long Spearmen, Peasant Archers, and Peasant Horsemen units

technology.short_description: If the great magnets within a War Compass are suddenly inverted, they will repulse incoming fusillades, scattering missiles like blossom on the breeze.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 40% for Wu Xing War Compass units

technology.short_description: With Celestial fire coursing through their veins, quaffed without hesitation from a jade goblet, the Dragon Emperor's honour guard shall never again know fatigue.

effects.description: Physical resistance: 5% for Celestial Dragon Guard units

technology.short_description: Retired Gate Masters – with the Dragon Emperor's tacit approval – often train underworld denizens in the ways of the Jade Warriors. In this way, even criminals are taught balance.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +30%

technology.short_description: Some say meditation is relaxation. This is a grave misconception, for Yang meditation amplifies the will and dampens all need. Its most capable practitioners can go days without rest or fodder.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +5% for Yang armies

technology.short_description: The Dragon Emperor's Celestial hand shall ease our path, no matter what might assail us on the way. All we need do is look for His radiance, and follow after it.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +5% for Yang armies
Casualty replenishment rate: +5% for Yin armies

technology.short_description: A drying process, taught by an Ogre Butcher outcast from his tribe due to too many vegetable-based recipes, strengthens peasants' makeshift armour without rendering it brittle.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Peasant Long Spearmen units

technology.short_description: It is said that each stone sentinel sings a constant and divine song of purification, sadly inaudible to all those not born of Dragon-blood.
The House of Secrets refuses to disclose quite which reagents have been added to the mixture, but there is no denying that it builds sturdy structures at minimal cost.

effects.description: Construction cost: -10% for Province Capital/Settlement buildings

technology.short_description: Every soul in the Celestial Empire, no matter how low-born, is deserving of the Dragon Emperor's care. It falls to Yuan Bo, the Jade Dragon, to share His purse amongst the commonfolk.

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Peasant Long Spearmen, Peasant Archers and Peasant Horsemen units

technology.short_description: There are those who obtain status through ignoble means, and there are those who debase their heraldry. Fortunately, true Dragon-blooded may replace them at a whim.

effects.description: [HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide
Lord recruit rank: +4 for Caravan Masters

technology.short_description: By putting ego to one side and working together, there is no limit to the innovations the outcast Sorcerers of the House of Secrets might devise.

effects.description: Hero action success chance: +10% for Astromancers

technology.short_description: The people cannot protest against the Jade Dragon's law if they are paid in the Jade Dragon's coin.

effects.description: Control: +2 in own provinces where an army is present

technology.short_description: Yin-Yin rules over the Jade Sea and far beyond, and it she who keeps Cathay's ports safe from crime and corruption. Only by the Sea Dragon's grace is fresh trade allowed or disallowed.
The great inventions of the City of Smoke generate more wealth than most other empires put together. We are fortunate indeed that it shares its technologies with us.
The House of Secrets skirts the edges of morality and legality, but a carefully-worded edict would further legitimise its renegade wizards. In turn, it would share its best and brightest with us.

effects.description: Hero action success chance: +10% for Alchemists

technology.short_description: It is on the backs of the hard-working commonfolk that every noble of Cathay stands, and it is past time they were shown gratitude. Send forth for the finest dishes in all the Celestial Empire!
Every child of Cathay is taught to fear the Great Enemy, but as adulthood descends, so too does temptation grow. Mandatory re-education and thrice-daily prayer to the Dragon Emperor is thus required.

effects.description: Leadership: +4 when fighting against Daemons of Chaos

technology.short_description: A single brass lever activates thousands of pulleys, arranged in a dense lattice even the most brilliant of minds could not untangle, and quickly drags the Compass into shuddering arrangement.
By harnessing the magic of Azyr, Xen Yang may divine what is to come, and thus He shall know the hour of our need. When He tells His faithful that hour has not yet come, they shall believe Him.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve: +5 per turn
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition

technology.short_description: Because the Moon Empress blesses every arrow in the Celestial Empire, it is contingent upon our fletchers to construct them with the utmost care, and our archers to not waste even a single shot.

effects.description: Ammunition: +10% for Peasant Archers, Celestial Dragon Crossbowmen and Jade Warrior Crossbowmen units

technology.short_description: As the moon's silver light washes over us, Quai Yin shall grant Her blessing. Darkness shall hone our blades, and shadows shall form our armour.

The Dragon Emperor has seen countless species rise and fall, and can teach us much of them. The ancient Chelonian turtles possessed nigh-unbreakable shells – this, we can recreate with wood and steel.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Peasant Long Spearmen units
Melee defence: +4 for Peasant Long Spearmen units

technology.short_description: The grand artificers of Cathay's impregnable heart of industry are capable of creating weapons reputedly as everlasting as the Great Bastion itself.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Jade Warriors (Halberds) and Celestial Dragon Guard units
Weapon strength: +10% for Jade Warriors (Halberds) and Celestial Dragon Guard units

technology.short_description: What the warriors of wind and field might lack in formal training they make up for with the wily skills of born hunters.

effects.description: Attribute: Stalk for Peasant Archers units

technology.short_description: The cloak of darkness is merely a state of mind. Practitioners of Yin can attune to it at will, and thus move unseen and unheard even in the broadest daylight.
By augmenting each missile's tip with shards of the Celestial Dragon's most favoured stone, they shall become able to pierce even the strongest steel.

effects.description: Armour-piercing missile damage: +15% for Celestial Dragon Crossbowmen units

technology.short_description: The Terracotta Sentinels are ancient indeed, but the Celestial Court believes it can recreate the invocations Xen Yang used to infuse their stone forms with a semblance of life so long ago.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +20% for Terracotta Sentinel units

technology.short_description: The Moon Empress weeps for every fallen child of Cathay. For this reason, she has been known to walk amongst those who follow her creed, disguised as a peasant healer, tending to the wounded and dying.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +5% for Yin armies

technology.short_description: "Strike fast, strike hard, no mercy" is a fine mantra, but futile should the enemy feel similarly. Defence is of equal import, and uncannily lightweight alchemical steel shall provide it.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Jade Warriors, Jade Warriors (Halberds), Jade Warrior Crossbowmen and Jade Warrior Crossbowmen (Shields) units

technology.short_description: Patience, planning and practice: this is the way of the Yin. Obey this creed always, and we shall move as the night wind – silent, graceful and unimpeded by any obstacle.
True balance requires the trust and participation of all souls. Only when we think and work as one will absolute harmony of purpose be achieved.
The Moon Empress shall bind our foes in tendrils of night, and in balance her kiss shall grant our bows new strength.

effects.description: Enemy Hero action success chance: -10% for Yin armies

technology.short_description: Our legion can learn to draw from within themselves an invisible miasma of the Moon Empress' enduring love, which as it envelops our foes shall blunt their every strike.
Previously unseen beyond the Forests of the Moon, a pitch-black tree which yields lumber as tough as fresh-forged iron has spread to the slopes of Kunlan – no doubt with Quai Yin's blessing.

effects.description: Construction time: -1 for Yin infrastructure buildings

technology.short_description: To drink of purest Yin energy, filtered from the silver waters of the Dragon River, is to become as swift and weightless as a spirit, unbound by corporeal convention.
The Ogre merchants of the Ivory Road charge a pretty penny to have their trained Giants stomp on our cannon wadding, but the compressed results can be loaded with incredible speed.

effects.description: Reload time reduction: +10% for Grand Cannon units

technology.short_description: Some mistake darkness for wickedness. Those who worship Quai Yin know that, in truth, darkness is purity, and to give themselves to the peace of night will answer their every need.
Great feats of archery, great deeds of subterfuge, great acts of charity: this is how the Moon Dragon's blessed favour is won.

effects.description: Grants the Banner of the Empress’ Eye banner to your faction

items.colour_text: Those that loose their arrows under this banner blessed by the Empress gain unerring accuracy.

technology.short_description: When its powder is laced with deadly Warpstone, courtesy of the House of Secrets' e'er-scheming Alchemists, each fresh Fire Rain rocket can be produced for a fraction of its former cost.

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -20% for Fire Rain Rocket units
Recruit rank: +2 for Fire Rain Rocket units
Missile strength: +10% for Iron Hail Gunners, Crane Gunners, Grand Cannon and Fire Rain Rocket units

technology.short_description: Come the next rainstorm, a system of canals and reservoirs can capture and share the Dragon River's over-spilling, mystic waters far and wide. And thus, the Yin shall flow.
The Moon Empress loves every child of Cathay dearly, but she most favours those who show fealty to the elemental winds of shadow and spirit.

effects.description: Grants the Banner of the Moon Empress banner to your faction

items.colour_text: The Moon Empress sets her own conventions. Chief amongst these is the ability to pass without being noticed whenever she chooses…

technology.short_description: A criss-crossing of miniature blades within the gun barrel's interior scores hundreds of vicious edges into every piece of shot. Only Nan-Gau's most diligent artificers can achieve this feat.

effects.description: Armour-piercing missile damage: +15% for Iron Hail Gunner units

technology.short_description: Vermillion Warbird hatchlings, before they reach full and fiery maturity, may be used as spotters, scattering harmless dancing flames in the vicinity of Crane Gunners' distant targets.

effects.description: Armour-piercing missile damage: +10% for Crane Gunners units

technology.short_description: A critical fortress such as the Great Bastion is naturally supplied by the finest armorers in Cathay. However, in this time of all-out war some of their shipments must be diverted elsewhere.
Absolute discipline. Perfect alignment of purpose. Every soldier knowing their place. This is the Harmony of Stone and Steel.

effects.description: Melee defence: +4 for Peasant Long Spearmen, Celestial Dragon Guard, Jade Warriors and Jade Warriors (Halberds) units

technology.short_description: The trade guilds of the Celestial Empire can trace their lineage back thousands of years. Their oldest carriages are so ornate, external platforms have been added for storage.

Blood means more in the Celestial Empire, where certain bloodlines have proven advantages in physical and mental acumen. Those who are so honored to be descended from the Dragon Emperor are often chosen for positions of leadership.
A fresh edict: only those born to a family which has known no short-sightedness or blindness for five generations may wield a Jade crossbow. Even then, they must prove themselves.

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Jade Warrior Crossbowmen and Jade Warrior Crossbowmen (Shields) units
Recruit rank: +2 for Jade Warrior Crossbowmen and Jade Warrior Crossbowmen (Shields) units

technology.short_description: The Celestial Dragon warriors are known for their art and poetry when off campaign. Their inspired showings attract great crowds who wish to learn from those blessed by the Dragons.

effects.description: Upkeep: -10% for Celestial Dragon Guard and Celestial Dragon Crossbowmen units

technology.short_description: No more will any of our soldiers be expendable. No expense is spared in ensuring every soldier makes it home alive, or at least alive long enough to fall in glorious battle.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 10% for all units (Rank 7 and above)

technology.short_description: When not dousing the Dragon Emperor's foes in purifying flame, the Dragon Fire Throwers mounted upon a Sky-Junk's perimeter can belch their emissions towards the craft's rear, further increasing thrust.
